discourse_list.title: How JokeDAO can help improve MakerDAO Governance, on Drinks w/MakerDAO Delegates

content.content: Back In Black In this episode of Drinks with MakerDAO, we talk with Feedblack Loops Founder Tim Black @twblack88  on how JokeDAO can be used as a soft consensus tool in decentralized governance, the arrival of MIP65, and the other weekly happenings in MakerDAO governance. Raphael @rspa and I really enjoyed speaking with Tim, and we hope that you’ll enjoy this episode as well. JokeDAO link: JokeDAO 🃏 An open-source, collaborative decision-making platform.  Not Financial Advice This Content is for entertainment and informational purposes only, you should not construe any such information or other material as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice. Nothing contained on the FlipFlopFlap YouTube Channel constitutes a solicitation, recommendation, endorsement, or offer by Tim Black, Frank Cruz, Raphael Spannocchi, Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC, Feedback Loops LLC, Flipside Crypto, or any third party service provider to buy or sell any cryptocurrencies, securities, or other financial instruments. Nothing in this YouTube Video constitutes professional and/or financial advice.  The Tastings Raphael:  Ayahuasca, top kek! No, it was… Moonmilk with Ashwaghanda  3.5 Stars     Tim Black:  Airbnb Coffee, mass-produced east-coast delight: 2.5 Stars    Frank: Juan Valdez Organic Coffee from Carulla: 4 Stars
content.GPT-summary: The post discusses the potential use of JokeDAO as a soft consensus tool in decentralized governance, and the arrival of MIP65. The author also provides a link to JokeDAO and a disclaimer that the content is for entertainment and informational purposes only. A third party, Tim Black, is interviewed and provides a rating for his coffee.
